result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A. Paulson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.
Must report to Probation today.  May petition the court for early discharge after 1 year.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be a judgment.

No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Not to possess or use drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide DNA sample.  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by probation.  Subject to work release, no good time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

CASES: 14CF413, 14CM102 & 16CM42.  Defendant Justin A. Paulson in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:00 am.  
16CM42-Count 1-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Exh 1-O&R.  
14CF413-Count 1-AMENDED Poss THC, 2nd off, fel-961.41(3g)(e).  NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
14CM102-DRI.
Def waiving PSI.  
CT finds elig for SA pgm & CIP.  
SENTENCE:
16CM42-$250 restitution to Jamie W. Payable thru bond.  $265.60, DNA sample, $200 surcharge.  Bond to be applied.  

14CF413- I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Credit for 68 days.  2 yr Probation.  No illegal substances, follow rules of supervision.  may petition the court for early discharge at 1 yr.  $290.60, DNA sample, $250 surcharge-payable thru COCC, bond to be applied.  60 days CT banked for use by probation, subj to WR no GT.  
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
PCR.  Must report to probation today.  9:31 am adj.
